books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties that tells the story of Jay Gatsby's unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A novel about racial injustice in the Deep South, seen through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A story about teenage angst and alienation told through the eyes of Holden Caulfield.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: The prelude to The Lord of the Rings, following the journey of Bilbo Baggins.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A romantic novel that also offers a critique of societal expectations in 19th-century England.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of technological control over humanity.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.description: A philosophical novel that follows the journey of a shepherd boy named Santiago in search of his personal legend.

books.title: Moby Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: A novel about the obsessive quest of Captain Ahab to seek revenge on the white whale, Moby Dick.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: An epic fantasy adventure that follows the journey to destroy the One Ring.
